Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
fix: force IPv4 database connections and use Docker deployment on Render

Fixes the deployment failure caused by Render''s lack of IPv6 support.
Changes:
- Add custom dialer to force TCP4 connections in postgres.go
- Update render.yaml to use Docker deployment for better control
- Change service name to match repository name \(habit-tracker\)

This resolves the "network is unreachable" error when connecting to 
Supabase PostgreSQL database from Render''s infrastructure.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
fix: add custom DNS resolver to filter IPv4 addresses only

Enhances the IPv4-only connection fix by implementing a custom
LookupFunc that filters DNS results to return only IPv4 addresses.
This ensures the hostname resolution doesn''t return IPv6 addresses
that Render cannot connect to.

If Supabase doesn''t provide IPv4 addresses, alternative solutions
may be needed \(connection pooler, different platform, etc.\).

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")
